CatDescriptText: Gerald Foreman, accountant, Mt. Lebanon, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 17, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you believe that city patrolmen and firemen should be required to work more than 40 hours per week?" answer reads: "Yes, if they are paid additional compensation, in the form of money, like anyother [sic] employe [sic]--union members in particular."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Gerald Foreman wearing sunglasses, striped knit tie, and striped jacket, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
